program: Sastera Sains Sosial (Social Sciences and Humanities)
subject: History

overview.description: Comprehensive history curriculum exploring Malaysian history, world civilizations, historical research methods, and critical analysis of historical sources and events

learning_objectives: Understand the development of Malaysian civilization and nationhood
Analyze major world historical events and their interconnections
Apply historical research methods and source analysis
Develop critical thinking about historical narratives and perspectives
Appreciate the relevance of history to contemporary issues

units.title: Early Malaysian Civilizations and Trade Networks
learning_outcomes: Understand the development of early kingdoms in the Malay Peninsula
Analyze the role of trade in shaping Malaysian societies
Evaluate the impact of external influences on local cultures
Assess archaeological evidence and historical sources

lessons.title: The Srivijaya and Majapahit Maritime Empires
objectives: Understand the rise and expansion of maritime empires
Analyze the factors contributing to their economic success
Evaluate their political and cultural influence on the region

activities.description: Analyze primary sources including Chinese chronicles and Arabic texts
Map trade routes and territorial extent of maritime empires
Examine archaeological artifacts and discuss their historical significance
Compare maritime empires with contemporary land-based kingdoms

resources: Historical maps and trade route charts
cross_curricular_connections: Geography: Trade routes and maritime navigation
Economics: Ancient trade systems and currency

lessons.title: The Malacca Sultanate: Politics, Trade, and Culture
objectives: Understand the establishment and governance of the Malacca Sultanate
Analyze Malacca's role as a major trading hub
Evaluate the cultural synthesis in Malaccan society

activities.description: Investigate the Sejarah Melayu and Portuguese chronicles
Simulate diplomatic negotiations between different cultural groups
Study Malaccan art, architecture, and literature
Discuss the lasting impact of the Malacca Sultanate

resources: Images of Malaccan architecture and artifacts
cross_curricular_connections: Literature: Classical Malay texts and oral traditions
Art: Islamic and local artistic traditions

units.title: Colonial Period and Resistance Movements
learning_outcomes: Understand the process and impact of European colonization
Analyze local resistance and adaptation strategies
Evaluate the transformation of traditional societies
Assess the economic and social changes during colonial rule

lessons.title: British Colonial Administration and Economic Policies
objectives: Understand the development of British administrative systems
Analyze the impact of colonial economic policies
Evaluate changes in land ownership and labor systems

activities.description: Analyze British colonial policies and their implementation
Study the transformation of agricultural and mining sectors
Compare colonial policies in different Malaysian states
Discuss multiple perspectives on colonial impact

lessons.title: Local Resistance and Cultural Adaptation
objectives: Understand various forms of resistance to colonial rule
Analyze the role of traditional leaders in resistance movements
Evaluate cultural adaptation and preservation strategies

activities.description: Study major resistance movements like the Perak War
Analyze the roles of leaders like Dato Maharajalela
Study how communities preserved their cultural practices
Connect historical resistance to modern independence movements

cross_curricular_connections: Social Studies: Leadership and social movements
Literature: Resistance narratives and oral traditions

units.title: Independence Movement and Nation Building
learning_outcomes: Understand the development of nationalist movements
Analyze the process of achieving independence
Evaluate challenges in nation-building and unity
Assess Malaysia's role in regional and global contexts

lessons.title: The Rise of Nationalist Movements and Political Parties
objectives: Understand the formation of early political organizations
Analyze the strategies used by nationalist leaders
Evaluate the role of different communities in the independence movement

activities.description: Create detailed timeline of political party formation and activities
Research and present biographies of key independence leaders
Analyze different approaches to achieving independence
Discuss how different communities worked together

resources: Speeches and writings of independence leaders
Newspaper archives from the independence period
cross_curricular_connections: Language Arts: Political rhetoric and communication

lessons.title: The Road to Merdeka: Negotiations and Compromise
objectives: Understand the negotiation process leading to independence
Analyze the compromises made during constitutional discussions
Evaluate the significance of the Federal Constitution

activities.description: Simulate the London Conference negotiations
Analyze key provisions of the Federal Constitution
Evaluate the compromises made and their long-term impacts
Reflect on the lasting significance of independence

units.title: Historical Research Methods and Historiography
learning_outcomes: Master historical research methodology and source evaluation
Understand different schools of historical interpretation
Apply critical analysis to historical narratives

lessons.title: Primary and Secondary Source Analysis
objectives: Distinguish between primary and secondary sources
Apply source criticism and evaluation techniques
Understand bias and perspective in historical sources

activities.description: Classify different types of historical sources
Apply external and internal criticism to sources
Identify bias and perspective in historical accounts
Assess the reliability of different source types

cross_curricular_connections: Critical Thinking: Logical analysis and evaluation

lessons.title: Independent Historical Research Project
objectives: Design and conduct original historical research
Apply multiple research methods and sources
Present findings in academic format

activities.description: Select research topic and develop research questions
Conduct library and archival research
Analyze findings and synthesize conclusions
Present research findings to class

cross_curricular_connections: Information Literacy: Database and archive usage

core_experiments: Oral history interview techniques and recording
Historical map analysis and cartographic interpretation
field_studies: Local historical site visits and documentation
project_work: Family or community history research project
Historical debate and mock trial preparations

textbooks: Malaysian History: From Early Kingdoms to Modern Nation
Historical Research Methods and Source Analysis
digital_resources: Virtual museum and historical site tours

cross_curricular_integration.literature: Historical literature and primary source texts
cross_curricular_integration.art: Historical art, architecture, and cultural artifacts
